PARAMETER.NAME: connectionType
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Supported SmartSocket versions.

PARAMETER.NAME: server
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: List of rtserver logical connection names following the format: 'protocol:node:port'. This should match the RTserver's conn_names option. If set to NULL, this option defaults to 'tcp:_node:5101' on Windows and 'local:_node' on Solaris.

PARAMETER.NAME: unique_subject
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Always used as the sender property of a message sent to RTserver through a given connection. When a connection is first opened to RTserver, it automatically subscribes to its unique subject. RTservers in a cloud do not allow multiple processes to have the same unique subject.

PARAMETER.NAME: project
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: A self-contained unit or partition that prevents unwanted messages from being sent to processes, in that connections in different projects cannot send messages to each other. A connection belongs to only one project, while an RTserver can provide publish-subscribe routing services for one or more projects. If set to NULL, this option defaults to 'rtworks'.

PARAMETER.NAME: subject_prefix
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the qualifier to prepend to message subject. names that don't start with /. Subject names are organized in a hierarchical namespace where the components are delimited by /. A subject name that starts with / is called an absolute subject name. All non-absolute subject names have Default_Subject_Prefix prepended to them. If set to NULL, this option defaults to '/'.

PARAMETER.NAME: gmdSubject
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the subject that the GMD will use for the connection. This should be set for any process that is going to send GMD Messages. Note: The unique_subject will be overwritten with this value if set. This means that the value must be unique on the RTserver as defined by the unique_subject.

PARAMETER.NAME: gmdResend
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether or not to automatically resend any messages in the file-based GMD area. By default all outstanding messages will be deleted when the process restarts.

PARAMETER.NAME: isThreaded
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Initializes the thread API and turns on internal thread synchronization calls within the utility and IPC libraries. Programs that call SmartSockets API functions from more than one thread must first call this function, even if they do not use any of the other thread API functions. This protects the integrity of the library's internal data structures. Single-threaded programs should set isThreaded to false, and indeed should avoid doing so for optimum performance. The added overhead of internal thread synchronization calls is not needed for single-threaded programs.

PARAMETER.NAME: CommandFile
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Submits a file to the process' command interface for execution. This method does not search for file_name in any directories such as the SmartSockets standard directory, but simply uses file_name verbatim.

PARAMETER.NAME: CommandString
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Submits a string to the command interface for execution.

PARAMETER.NAME: Compress
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Turns on/off MSG compression. To set the type of compression, and other SS options use the CommandFile, or CommandString options. Decompression is automatic, and occurs when any Message::GetField() call is made for the first time.

PARAMETER.NAME: AutoServerReconnect
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Turns on/off server reconnect after disconnect. This facilitates automatic handling of failover and server going down for extended period.

PARAMETER.NAME: ReconnectAttempts
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: If AutoServerReconnect is true, this is the number of times to try to reconnect. Less than or equal to 0 is infinite (default). Greater than 0 and the client will try to reconnect to the server that many times.

PARAMETER.NAME: ReconnectDelay
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: This is the delay between reconnect attempts (in milliseconds).

PARAMETER.NAME: IPC_GMD_TYPE
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether file-based or memory-based GMD is to be used. If left to its default value of default, file-based GMD is attempted, and if that is unsuccessful, memory-based GMD is used. If the value is set to memory, memory-based GMD is used.This option is only for use with GMD.

PARAMETER.NAME: SERVER_DISCONNECT_MODE
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the action RTserver should take when the RTclient disconnects from RTserver. warm - RTserver saves subject information about RTclient for GMD so that no messages are lost. gmd_failure - RTserver destroys all information about RTclient and causes pending guaranteed message delivery to fail. gmd_success - RTserver destroys all information about RTclient and causes pending guaranteed message delivery to succeed.

PARAMETER.NAME: SERVER_MAX_RECONNECT_DELAY
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the upper bound on a random delay introduced when an the RTclient has to reconnect to RTserver. This option is useful when an RTserver with many clients fails and all of those RT processes are attempting to reconnect. The delay enhances total reconnect time by slightly staggering reconnect requests. Setting the option to zero disables the delay.

PARAMETER.NAME: COMMAND_FEEDBACK
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Specifies when feedback is displayed after a command is successfully executed. If the command results in an error such as incorrect syntax, feedback is always displayed, regardless of the value of Command_Feedback. The three possible values for Command_Feedback are: always - feedback is always given, regardless of how the command was executed, interactively or using a CONTROL message. interactive - feedback is only given when the command is entered interactively. never - feedback is never given.

PARAMETER.NAME: SERVER_KEEP_ALIVE_TIMEOUT
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: Occurs if more than Server_Read_Timeout seconds have elapsed since the RT process (RTclient) last read any data from that RTserver. Keep alives are disabled if Server_Keep_Alive_Timeout is set to 0.0.

PARAMETER.NAME: server
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: This parameter specifies the internet address (name or ip) of the machine on which the Message Bus Server software service is running.

PARAMETER.NAME: port
PARAMETER.DESCRIPTION: This parameter specified the internet port to connect to for the Message Bus software service. The default is port 9100.

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Requested start time of the messages to be retrieved from the Message Archive.

FIELD.NAME: STOP-TIME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Requested stop time of the messages to be retrieved from the Message Archive. Defaults to the end of the Message Archive.

FIELD.NAME: DELIVER-VIA-REFERENCE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates if the data will be referenced by a URI in the single response message. Defaults to No. FALSE:No/False TRUE:Yes/True

FIELD.NAME: DELIVER-VIA-INCLUDE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates if the data is to be included in the single response message. Defaults to Yes. FALSE:No/False TRUE:Yes/True

FIELD.NAME: PROD-TYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Product type being requested.

FIELD.NAME: PROD-SUBTYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Product subtype being requested.

FIELD.NAME: NUM-OF-PROD-SUBTYPES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of further delineations/categories beyond the product subtype. Also, used as msg subject elements me5, me6, etc. in the Product Message.

FIELD.NAME: PROD-SUBTYPE.1.NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: First subcategory of the product subtype. (Subject elements me5, me6, etc. of the Product Message).

FIELD.NAME: URI
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Location where the requesting component is asking for the product file(s) to be stored. Could be a web address, directory or folder specification.

FIELD.NAME: NAME-PATTERN
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Describes the name of the output file.

FIELD.NAME: FORMAT
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Describes the file format.

FIELD.NAME: VERSION
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies the version of the file.

FIELD.NAME: SIZE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum size of the file acceptable to the requester. Size specified in KB.

FIELD.NAME: REQ-STRING
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific to the responder / provider of the requested information. The string will define a database query, a script expression, Unix statement, or some other statement for extracting the information from the providers repository.

FIELD.NAME: NUM-OF-MSGS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the number of different message type / subtype pairs requested from the Message Archive.

FIELD.NAME: MSG.1.TYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Message Type/Subtype pairing to identify the message to be retrieved from the archive.

FIELD.NAME: MSG.1.SUBTYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Message Type/Subtype pairing to identify the message to be retrieved from the archive.

FIELD.NAME: MSG.1.TIME-FIELD-NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of field in the message that contains the time to examine. Will default to PUBLISH-TIME in Info. Bus Header.

FIELD.NAME: MSG.1.TIME-TYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the format of the time to examine in the retrieved messages. Defaults to GMSEC standard time format. 0:Spacecraft Time 1:GMSEC std. Time

FIELD.NAME: MSG.1.NUM-OF-FIELDS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of message fields to examine and match for retrieval from the archive.

FIELD.NAME: MSG.1.FIELD.1.NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the message field to match for retrieval from the archive.

FIELD.NAME: MSG.1.FIELD.1.CONTENT
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Contents of the message field used in matching the messages for retrieval from the archive.

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique ID set by the originator for this directive. Can be a sequence number. Aids in synchronizing responses and other messaging related to the specific directive.

FIELD.NAME: REQUEST-TYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies the type of mnemonic value request message. 1:Oneshot 2:Start 3:Stop

FIELD.NAME: PUBLISH-RATE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies the rate, in number of seconds, which the Mnemonic Value Data messages are published. A rate of zero indicates that the server should publish the data as fast as possible. The default distribution rate is 5 seconds.

FIELD.NAME: DURATION
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Length of time, in seconds, for the request to be active, after which the data messages will automatically cease.

FIELD.NAME: NUM-OF-MNEMONICS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total Number of mnemonics being requested.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.DATA-TYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the data type to be returned, either the raw value, or the converted value (Engineering Units or Text converted), or both. Defaults to both. 1:Raw 2:Converted 3:Both

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.STATE-ATTRIBUTES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates if the State Attributes (flags, limits, static flag, and data quality) of the mnemonic are to be returned. Defaults to No. 1:No 2:Yes

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.CRITERIA
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identification of when data should be provided for the mnemonic. Includes either upon change of data (value, flags or status), or every sample, or at a specified sampling rate. The default Criteria is Change only data. 1:Change 2:Every sample 3:Sample rate

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE-RATE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If CRITERIA is specified as Sample Rate, this field will specify the data sampling rate for the mnemonic in milliseconds.

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies the status of the Mnemonic Value Request Message that was processed. 1:Acknowledgement 2:Failed completion 3:Successful Completion 4:Failed Completion 5:Invalid Request

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Time application completed processing the request.

FIELD.NAME: RETURN-VALUE

FIELD.NAME: NUM-OF-MNEMONICS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of mnemonics returned. Should echo the NUM-OF-MNEMONICS field in the request message.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the Mnemonic

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.STATUS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Status of the first mnemonic. 1:Valid 2:Valid,Nodata 3:Invalid

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.UNITS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Units associated with the value converted to engineering units for the first mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.NUM-OF-SAMPLES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of data samples for the first mnemonic. This field shall be either a zero or a one.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.TIME-STAMP
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Time stamp for the first data sample of the first mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.RAW-VALUE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Raw value for the first data sample of the first mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.LIMIT-ENABLE-DISABLE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the limit checking state. FALSE:Disabled TRUE:Enabled

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.RED-HIGH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the Red High limit status. FALSE:In-limits TRUE:Out-of-limits

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.RED-LOW
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the Red Low limit status. FALSE:In-limits TRUE:Out-of-limits

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.YELLOW-HIGH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the Yellow Hight limit status. FALSE:In-limits TRUE:Out-of-limits

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.YELLOW-LOW
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the Yellow Low limit status. FALSE:In-limits TRUE:Out-of-limits

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.STATIC
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the static(state) condition of the mnemonic. FALSE:Active TRUE:Static

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.QUALITY
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the Quality of the mnemonic. FALSE:Good quality TRUE:Questionable quality

FIELD.NAME: HEADER-VERSION
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Version number for this message.

FIELD.NAME: MESSAGE-TYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Message type identifier. REQ:Request RESP:Response MSG:Message

FIELD.NAME: MESSAGE-SUBTYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique message identifier, fixed for GMSEC Standard Messages.

FIELD.NAME: MISSION-ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique mission name.

FIELD.NAME: CONSTELLATION-ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Used for constellations.

FIELD.NAME: SAT-ID-PHYSICAL
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An ID for the satellite that is fixed for its mission life.

FIELD.NAME: SAT-ID-LOGICAL
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An ID for a single or group of satellites that can change during its mission life.

FIELD.NAME: FACILITY
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A physical source generating the message.

FIELD.NAME: PROCESS-ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Application ID for onboard events or Process ID for ground events.

FIELD.NAME: CLASS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Class/Component relationship and Class/Subclass relationship.

FIELD.NAME: COMPONENT
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of software application.

FIELD.NAME: SUBCOMPONENT1
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: First subsystem level within the component that produced the message.

FIELD.NAME: SUBCOMPONENT2
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Second subsystem level within the component that produced the message.

FIELD.NAME: USER-NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Account name or owner of the account that started this component.

FIELD.NAME: ROLE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Role the component is assigned in the configuration. 1:Primary 2:Secondary 3:Tertiary

FIELD.NAME: CONTENT-VERSION
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Version Number for this message content description.

FIELD.NAME: MSG-ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique ID set by the originator for this directive. Can be a sequence number. Aids in synchronizing responses and other messaging related to the specific directive.

FIELD.NAME: NUM-OF-MNEMONICS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of mnemonics in this message.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the Mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.STATUS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Status of the mnemonic. 1:Valid 2:Valid,Nodata 3:Invalid

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.UNITS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Units associated with the value converted to engineering units for the first mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.NUM-OF-SAMPLES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of data samples for the first mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.TIME-STAMP
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Time stamp for the first data sample of the first mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.RAW-VALUE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Raw value for the first data sample of the first mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.EU-VALUE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Raw value converted to Engineering Units if engineering units conversion is present for the first data sample of the first mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.TEXT-VALUE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Raw value converted to a text string if text conversion is present for the first data sample of the first mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.FLAGS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Flags native to the T and C component for the first data sample of the first mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.LIMIT-ENABLE-DISABLE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the limit checking state. FALSE:Disabled TRUE:Enabled

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.RED-HIGH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the Red High limit status. FALSE:In-limits TRUE:Out-of-limits

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.RED-LOW
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the Red Low limit status. FALSE:In-limits TRUE:Out-of-limits

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.YELLOW-HIGH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the Yellow High limit status. FALSE:In-limits TRUE:Out-of-limits

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.YELLOW-LOW
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the Yellow Low limit status. FALSE:In-limits TRUE:Out-of-limits

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.STATIC
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the static(state) condiction. FALSE:Active TRUE:Static

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE.1.QUALITY
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the Quality of the mnemonic. FALSE:Good quality TRUE:Questionable quality

FIELD.NAME: HEADER-VERSION
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Version number for this message.

FIELD.NAME: MESSAGE-TYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Message type identifier. REQ:Request RESP:Response MSG:Message

FIELD.NAME: MESSAGE-SUBTYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique message identifier, fixed for GMSEC Standard Messages.

FIELD.NAME: MISSION-ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique mission name.

FIELD.NAME: CONSTELLATION-ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Used for constellations.

FIELD.NAME: SAT-ID-PHYSICAL
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An ID for the satellite that is fixed for its mission life.

FIELD.NAME: SAT-ID-LOGICAL
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An ID for a single or group of satellites that can change during its mission life.

FIELD.NAME: FACILITY
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A physical source generating the message.

FIELD.NAME: PROCESS-ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Application ID for onboard events or Process ID for ground events.

FIELD.NAME: CLASS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Class/Component relationship and Class/Subclass relationship.

FIELD.NAME: COMPONENT
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of software application.

FIELD.NAME: SUBCOMPONENT1
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: First subsystem level within the component that produced the message.

FIELD.NAME: SUBCOMPONENT2
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Second subsystem level within the component that produced the message.

FIELD.NAME: USER-NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Account name or owner of the account that started this component.

FIELD.NAME: ROLE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Role the component is assigned in the configuration. 1:Primary 2:Secondary 3:Tertiary

FIELD.NAME: CONTENT-VERSION
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Version Number for this message content description.

FIELD.NAME: MSG-ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique ID set by the originator for this directive. Can be a sequence number. Aids in synchronizing responses and other messaging related to the specific directive.

FIELD.NAME: START-TIME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Requested start time of the mnemonic values to be retrieved from the telemetry archive.

FIELD.NAME: STOP-TIME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Requested stop time of the mnemonic values to be retrieved from the telemetry archive. Defaults to the end of the telemetry archive.

FIELD.NAME: PDB-VERSION
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Project Data Base version to be used by the responder when processing the archived data. Defaults to the PDB version used when the data was archived.

FIELD.NAME: RESPOND-VIA-MSG
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the message to use to deliver the mnemonic data. MSG will be a stream of messages; RESP will be a single response message. MSG.AMVAL:AMVAL Message RESP.AMVAL:AMVAL Response Message

FIELD.NAME: DELIVER-VIA-REFERENCE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This parameter is used only if 'RESP.AMVAL' is selected above. Indicates if the data will be referenced by a URI in the single response message. Defaults to No. FALSE:No/False TRUE:Yes/True

FIELD.NAME: DELIVER-VIA-INCLUDE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This parameter is used only if 'RESP.AMVAL' is selected above. Indicates if the data is to be included in the single response message. Defaults to Yes. FALSE:No/False TRUE:Yes/True

FIELD.NAME: PLAYBACK-RATIO
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If 'MSG.AMVAL' is selected above, specifies the speed of data delivery as a ratio of playback rate to real-time rate.

FIELD.NAME: DATA-RATE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If 'MSG.AMVAL' is selected above, specifies the speed of data delivery in Kilobits per second.

FIELD.NAME: DATA-RATE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The 'PROD-' fields are optionally used when the RESP.AMVAL has been specified above. Name of the product being requested.

FIELD.NAME: PROD-NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the product being requested.

FIELD.NAME: PROD-TYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Product type and subtype being requested.

FIELD.NAME: PROD-SUBTYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Product type and subtype being requested.

FIELD.NAME: NUM-OF-PROD-SUBTYPES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of further delineations / categories beyond the product subtype. Also, used as msg subject elements me5, me6, etc. in Product Message.

FIELD.NAME: PROD-SUBTYPE.1.NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: First subcategory of the product subtype.

FIELD.NAME: URI
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Location where the requesting component is asking for the product file(s) to be stored. Could be a web address, directory or folder specification.

FIELD.NAME: NAME-PATTERN
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Describes the name of the output file.

FIELD.NAME: FORMAT
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Describes the file format.

FIELD.NAME: VERSION
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies the version of the file.

FIELD.NAME: SIZE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum size of the file acceptable to the requester (in kilobytes).

FIELD.NAME: NUM-OF-MNEMONICS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total Number of mnemonics being requested.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the mnemonic.

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.DATA-TYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the data type to be returned. 1:Raw 2:Converted 3:Both

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.STATE-ATTRIBUTES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates if the state attributes of the mnemonic are to be returned. 1:No 2:Yes

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.CRITERIA
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identification of how data should be sampled for the mnemonic. 1:Change(value, flags, status) 2:Every Sample 3:Sample Rate

FIELD.NAME: MNEMONIC.1.SAMPLE-RATE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If CRITERIA is specified as Sample Rate, this field will specify the data sampling rate for the mnemonic (in milliseconds).

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Category of product. AAA:Archive and Assessment AUTO:Automation FD:Flight Dynamics MAS:Modeling and Simulation PAS:Planning and Scheduling SC:Scripting Control TAC:Telemetry and Command

FIELD.NAME: PROD-SUBTYPE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Product subtype being requested.

FIELD.NAME: NUM-OF-PROD-SUBTYPES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of further delineations / categories beyond the product subtype.

FIELD.NAME: PROD-SUBTYPE.1.NAME
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: First subcategory of the product subtype.

FIELD.NAME: NUM-OF-FILES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the number of files included in this response message.

FIELD.NAME: FILE.1.URI
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: URI specifying the location where the file of the product is stored.

FIELD.NAME: FILE.1.NAME-PATTERN
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Describes the name of the output file.

FIELD.NAME: FILE.1.FORMAT
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Describes the file format.

FIELD.NAME: FILE.1.VERSION
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies the version of the file.

FIELD.NAME: FILE.1.SIZE
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Size of the included file (in kilobytes).

FIELD.NAME: FILE.1.DATA
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum size of the file acceptable to the requester (in kilobytes).
